Message.Title: this week jan 6
Message.Msg: GOP senate minority leader Mitch Mcconnell says “the revenue line is set and now off limits”, claiming “the biggest problem is spending”. And there he stands, rigid., proclaiming that the president must know we are spending too much. Thus, of course, spend less, lower the debt burden for those cherished grandchildren who will be paying future bills… Former Clinton adm figure Robt Reich says “jobs must be the issue” and the economy, USA and larger, will suffer if the “full faith and credit” of USA is challenged by national debt ceiling matter. There are other issues, gun control, immigration, a new secy of defense proposed…he might not be a staunch Israel defender And there are sponsors—yes several aimed at the aged—reverse mortgages, diabetes, etc, etc, and even “catheters”. Dell was present, twice. AIG, proudly saying TARP dollars paid back, plus an added ten-plus per cent for the USA treasury…saying, too, AIG helped rebuild Joplin and will do same for Sandy victims. G f Will plugged a nice Texan conservative, Jeb Hensarling…now we watch him as well as Paul Ryan? Apparently “we” mark time in January, waiting for the inauguration and the budget cuts Sen McConnell threatens must take place to raise the national debt ceiling. Meanwhile, young children in Newtown go to a different school. Young or otherwise, they remember, and do, or should. We also remembered one member of the military, Floridian, age 20, who made the ultimate sacrifice in Afghanistan.

Message.Title: When teaching your wife or girlfriend how to shoot a gun
Message.Msg: you should always teach her how to reload and finish the job: A Georgia mother shot a gay half Black, half Mexican, Union Democrat ex-convict six times to protect her and her children after he apparently forced his way into the family’s home. The mom heard knocks on her front door Friday and assumed it was just a solicitor, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported. She told her 9-year-old twins not to answer the door and, when the visitor began repeatedly ringing the doorbell, she called her husband at his job and he told her to gather the children and hide. “He opens the closet door and finds himself staring down the barrel of a .38 revolver.” According to the Journal-Constitution, the father then dialed 911 and his wife, who works from a home office, hid with the children in a crawlspace. By that time, according to the paper, the intruder had used a crowbar to forcibly enter the home, and made his way to the home office. “He opens the closet door and finds himself staring down the barrel of a .38 revolver,” Walton County Sheriff Joe Chapman told the Atlanta Journal-Constitution. The woman fired six bullets, five of which hit Paul Ali Slater in the face and neck area, Chapman said. But Slater, who has arrests dating to 2008 and was released from jail in August, was still conscious. “The guy’s face down, crying,” the sheriff said. The woman told him to stay down or she’d shoot again. While down, the woman and her children ran to a neighbor’s house, and the injured intruder made it out of the home and into his car, the paper reported. Authorities found Slater a short time later bleeding profusely in a neighbor’s driveway. “I’m dying. Help me,” he told them, according to Chapman. Slater was transported to Gwinnett Medical Center and is expected to survive, the sheriff said.

Topic.Title: BAC this upcoming week

Message.Msg: I'd hold 'em unless something overwhelmingly negative crops up. It looks like BAC is setting up to run to $12.50...and this might carry it to the $13 area though the next real resistance area is in the $13.50 area. The only caveat I place on all this is that from a TA perspective most indicators are signaling overbought. So there will probably continue to be a bit of consolidative sideways to the upside action as time works off that overbought situation. Ultimately this year, though I tend to shy away from prognostications, it wouldn't surprise me to see BAC at $15 towards the latter half of 2013. All just my 2pennies worth. Let's see how the week unfolds. (Also, disclosure, I'm sitting on a sizable basket of BAC from just south of $6 so consider the source) Highlow American Net'Zen

Topic.Title: BAC this upcoming week

Message.Msg: Technically BAC is overbought. It closed at it's high on Friday on lower than average volume. At the same time, BAC has blown through a number of major resistance points in recent history and could continue to rise further without much trouble. I do believe like many others that you are going to run into some major resistance around the 12.50 area before it moves much higher. Bottomline, in the short-term make your own decision to stay in or get out and ignore everyone's opinion. FYI: All I'm going to do with regards to BAC over the next few weeks is day trade it based on the (daily) technicals - too much risk for me hold a position overnight (long or short) since our government leaders still have two months to raise and lower our blood pressure at will.
